definition: connected with being a father; typical of a kind father
related through the father’s side of the family
having feelings that are typical of a caring mother towards a child
connected with being a mother
related through the mother’s side of the family
the act or process of making something clearer or easier to understand
the act of making something clearer by explaining it more fully
to link a group, a company or an organization very closely with another, larger one
to join, to be connected with, or to work for an organization

the green-brown liquid with a bitter unpleasant taste that is produced by the liver to help the body to deal with the fats we eat, and that can come into your mouth when you vomit with an empty stomach
a strong feeling of anger or hating somebody/something
a medical condition in which the skin and the white parts of the eyes become yellow, caused by disease of the liver or blood
a European bird of the heron family, that lives on wet ground and has a loud call
not written in any particular key
a rich person who helps the poor and those in need, especially by giving money
a person who risks money on a card game, horse race, etc.
a person who is willing to risk losing something in the hope of being successful
a piece of equipment for blowing air into or through something. Bellows are used for making a fire burn better or for producing sound in some types of musical instruments.
a regular movement between one position and another or between one amount and another
a single movement from one position to another of something that is oscillating
a repeated change between different feelings, types of behaviour or ideas
the root of the ginger plant used in cooking as a spice
a light orange-brown colour
a female deer; a female of some other animals, including rabbits and hares
open and without shame, usually about something that shocks people
made of, or the colour of, brass
connected with the Pope
a device that controls the flow of water from a pipe
a tap that controls the flow of liquid or gas through a pipe
not feeling ashamed of something you have done, although other people think you should

a person employed to manage land or a large farm for somebody else
an official who keeps order in court, takes people to their seats, watches prisoners, etc.
to try to make somebody believe that you will do something that you do not really intend to do, or that you know something that you do not really know
to get out of a difficult situation by continuing to tell lies, especially when people suspect you are not being honest
to make something empty or dry by removing the liquid from it; to become empty or dry in this way
to make liquid flow away from something; to flow away
to empty a cup or glass by drinking everything in it
to make somebody/something weaker, poorer, etc. by using up their/its strength, money, etc.
